text: This is another movie that's been unfairly rated by old men who use nostalgia to drive their bitterness at a world that doesn't conform to them. It was not Oscar worthy but it was a fun watch that kept the MIB franchise alive.

This is yet another very average film. It’s hard to place why I didn’t like it more as it had excellent production quality and on paper much more potential than the direct sequels to the original. Sadly I found it very forgettable and pretty much the same level of enjoyment and engagement as the previous sequels but it should be better. I liked the casting but the only character I liked was Molly. The villains were cool. I don’t know, it just didn’t come together somehow.
What a waste of time with trash dialogues.
It's marginally better than MiB II, but otherwise it's a pretty dumb & boring action comedy with some fun effects work.

Was expecting so much of it, but it disappointed me. They indeed have a good CGI and special effects, but the story is just boring, it's not a big plot or a "mid" movie, it's just bad, I was relieved when the movie finally ended.

Filme fraco, o roteiro é fraco, as cenas são fracas, o elenco é mais ou menos, e ninguém ajuda a melhorar o filme, a história é fraca, os personagens sao fracos, e o filme deveria ter cenas bem melhores e relevantes para fazer o filme ser bom.
Not like the original movies but decent

I love the MIB trilogy but this movie disappointed me. I had high hopes because I love Chris Hemsworth and Liam Neeson but I honestly just found this movie boring. First actual bad one in an otherwise great franchise.

It is a kids movie after all.
Still better than Cars 2.
Was nice to be back in the MIB universe but this felt like a disingenuous remake. It's hard to follow up the original masterpieces but they should've tried harder.
**** you, Sony Pictures!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

While superficially similar to MiB 1-3, in fact it's lightyears away from them.
It's simply missing almost everything that made those ones vastly enjoyable: the creative firework, the tons of jokes that go beyond the usual, the believable humanity of its lead characters, the ability to constantly surprise the viewer; and, perhaps most of all, the deep irony that hangs above the whole thing and makes the viewers smile half of the movie time. 
Instead, this is a lazy movie that opts to fall back to cardboard leads and well known, worn-out Hollywood cliches. It tells a story the audience has seen a hundred times already, ending up as predictable and, despite the action, somewhat boring even. Ultimately this is a movie that displays Hollywood’s stringent technical professionalism in many ways, only it lacks the inspiration to give it an actual soul.
This just doesn’t feel like the “MIB”
There isn't another movie that made me want to walk out the cinema as much as this

This was by far the best MIB film....hopefully they make a sequel with the same actors! Please don't listen to these low IQ people that only complain about BS! 'ahhg it's not the same as the first 3 films' yeah no Sht Sherlock a reboot is not supposed to be the same!! It was and still is the best MIB film!! Rotten tomatoes meter should be 100%

I enjoyed it more the second time around and seeing the MIB world from the another perspective was probably what we needed. So I am kind of glad W. Smith turned it down, especially now that he's proved himself to be so incredibly unlikeable. I wouldn't mind seeing a sequel that connects both the USA and London branches in some way. But I'd imagine we're more likely to see a reboot.

An insult to the first film , this is a bland and tedious film full of all the worst aspects of Hollywood. There is no story arch for the lead character Tessa Thompson who plays agent M is one of the least likeable and believable characters in any film , she for no reason and with no training knows everything and can beat and outsmart agents who presumably have work for MIB for years . It’s pure garbage don’t watch it.
Entertaining and action-packed. Not particularly creative or novel compared to the previous movies but it delivered on my ecpectations.
It felt underdeveloped and very predictable, I think this could have been much better but the leads do not give the same comedic energy as Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones
The worst Mib movie👎
